com.martinandersson.money.lib.serializer

Interface Serializer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SerializationFramework

    public interface Serializer
    A serializer know how to serialize and deserialize any given object to/from a byte[] as well as to/from OutputStream/InputStream.

    You may call this interface an adapter, that bridge our code base to different serialization frameworks.

    The serializer implementation is thread-safe.

    See Also:
    SerializationFramework

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        default byte[] serialize(java.lang.Object object)
        Serialize specified object.
        Parameters:
        object - object to serialize
        Returns:
        object serialized
        Implementation Requirements:
        Default implementation uses serialize(Object, Consumer), passing null as duration.

      • serialize

        byte[] serialize(java.lang.Object object,
                 java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> duration)
        Serialize specified object.

        The duration consumer will receive the time it took to serialize the object in a nicely formatted String ("X.XXX ms").

        Parameters:
        object - object to serialize
        duration - duration consumer (may be null)
        Returns:
        object serialized

      • serialize

        void serialize(java.lang.Object object,
               java.io.OutputStream out)
        Serialize specified object.

        Please note that this method do not close the specified output stream.

        Parameters:
        object - object to serialize
        out - where to put the serialized bytes

      • deserialize

        default <T> T deserialize(byte[] bytes)
        Deserialize the specified bytes.
        Type Parameters:
        T - deserialized type
        Parameters:
        bytes - bytes to deserialize
        Returns:
        a object
        Implementation Requirements:
        The default implementation uses deserialize(byte[], Consumer), passing null as duration.

      • deserialize

        <T> T deserialize(byte[] bytes,
                  java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> duration)
        Deserialize the specified bytes.

        The duration consumer will receive the time it took to deserialize the bytes in a nicely formatted String ("X.XXX ms").

        Type Parameters:
        T - deserialized type
        Parameters:
        bytes - bytes to deserialize
        duration - duration consumer (may be null)
        Returns:
        an object

      • deserialize

        <T> T deserialize(java.io.InputStream in)
        Deserialize an object.

        Please note that this method do not close the specified input stream.

        Type Parameters:
        T - deserialized type
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        Returns:
        an object
